entity1.name: Physics of Roller Coasters
entity1.description: The scientific study of the principles and laws governing the motion, forces, and energy involved in roller coaster rides.

entity2.name: Roller coasters
entity2.description: Amusement park attractions designed to provide thrilling experiences through various elements such as twists, turns, drops, and loops.

entity3.name: Amusement park rides
entity3.description: A broad classification of entertainment facilities found in amusement parks, which include roller coasters among other attractions.

entity4.name: Roller Coasters
entity4.description: A type of amusement ride that uses tracks and steep inclines to create a thrilling experience for riders.

entity5.name: Physics
entity5.description: The natural science that involves the study of matter, its motion, and behavior through space and time, along with related concepts such as energy and force.

entity6.name: roller coasters
entity6.description: A type of amusement ride that features a track with steep drops, sharp turns, and sometimes loops.

entity7.name: forces
entity7.description: Physical interactions between objects that cause changes in motion or deformation.

entity8.name: energy conservation
entity8.description: The principle that energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transformed from one form to another.

entity9.name: acceleration
entity9.description: The rate of change of velocity with respect to time.

entity10.name: velocity
entity10.description: The rate of change of position with respect to time, including both speed and direction.

entity11.name: roller coasters
entity11.description: A type of amusement ride that is typically characterized by its steep drops, sharp turns, and high speeds.

entity12.name: forces
entity12.description: Physical interactions that cause changes in the motion or shape of objects; a key concept in physics for understanding how roller coasters operate.

entity13.name: gravitational force
entity13.description: A natural phenomenon that causes objects with mass to be attracted to each other.

entity14.name: centripetal force
entity14.description: The force that acts on a body moving in a circular path and is directed toward the center around which the body is moving.

entity15.name: friction
entity15.description: A force that resists the relative motion of objects or materials sliding against each other.

entity16.name: Gravitational force
entity16.description: A natural phenomenon that causes objects to be attracted toward the center of a celestial body, such as Earth.

entity17.name: Earth
entity17.description: The third planet from the Sun and the only known astronomical object to harbor life.

entity18.name: roller coaster
entity18.description: A mechanical ride found in amusement parks, consisting of a track with steep drops and sharp curves designed for thrill and excitement.

entity19.name: roller coaster car
entity19.description: A vehicle designed for amusement park rides, typically featuring a track with steep drops and sharp turns.

entity20.name: gravity
entity20.description: The natural force of attraction exerted by a celestial body, such as Earth, causing objects to fall towards it.

entity21.name: acceleration
entity21.description: The rate at which the velocity of an object changes over time.

entity22.name: weightlessness
entity22.description: A condition where a person or object feels as if they are weightless, often experienced in free-fall or zero-gravity environments.

entity23.name: airtime
entity23.description: The period during which riders on a roller coaster or similar ride feel as if they are floating, due to the sensation of weightlessness.

entity24.name: riders
entity24.description: Individuals who participate in or experience an activity, such as riding a roller coaster.

entity25.name: drop
entity25.description: A part of a ride where the vehicle and its passengers descend rapidly, often creating a sensation of weightlessness.

entity26.name: Centripetal force
entity26.description: A force that acts on a body moving in a circular path and is directed toward the center around which the body is moving.

entity27.name: Roller coasters
entity27.description: An amusement park ride developed for thrill and entertainment, typically consisting of a track with steep drops, sharp curves, and sometimes loops.

entity28.name: roller coaster car

entity29.name: track
entity29.description: The path or route that the roller coaster car follows, usually made of steel or wood.

entity30.name: Centripetal force
entity30.description: A force that acts on a body moving in a circular path and is directed toward the center around which the body is moving.

entity31.name: circular path
entity31.description: A path that follows the circumference of a circle, where all points on the path are equidistant from the center.

entity32.name: track
entity32.description: The surface or structure along which a vehicle moves, providing support and guidance.

entity33.name: car
entity33.description: A road vehicle, typically with four wheels, powered by an internal combustion engine or electric motor, used for transportation.

entity34.name: centripetal force
entity34.description: A force that acts on a body moving in a circular path and is directed toward the center around which the body is moving.

entity35.name: gravitational force
entity35.description: The force of attraction between two masses, such as the Earth pulling objects downward.

entity36.name: Friction
entity36.description: A force that opposes the motion of an object, often resulting from the interaction between two surfaces.

entity37.name: Roller Coaster
entity37.description: An amusement park ride that consists of a track with steep drops and sharp turns, designed to provide thrill and excitement.

entity38.name: roller coaster car
entity38.description: A vehicle designed for amusement park rides, typically moving on tracks and featuring steep drops and sharp turns.

entity39.name: track

entity40.name: car
entity40.description: A vehicle used for transportation, typically with four wheels and an internal combustion engine or electric motor.

entity41.name: Roller coaster designers
entity41.description: Individuals who design and create roller coasters for amusement parks.

entity42.name: friction
entity42.description: A force that resists the relative motion of solid surfaces, fluid layers, or material elements sliding against each other.

entity43.name: Energy conservation
entity43.description: A fundamental concept in physics that states energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transformed from one form to another.

entity44.name: Physics of roller coasters
entity44.description: The application of physical principles and laws to the design and operation of roller coasters.

entity45.name: Roller coasters
entity45.description: A type of amusement ride that uses elevated tracks and steep slopes to create a thrilling experience for riders.

entity46.name: mechanical energy
entity46.description: The total energy in a system, which is the sum of kinetic and potential energies.

entity47.name: kinetic energy
entity47.description: The energy an object possesses due to its motion.

entity48.name: potential energy
entity48.description: The energy an object has because of its position or configuration within a field, such as gravitational potential energy.

entity49.name: roller coaster
entity49.description: A ride in an amusement park that consists of a track with steep drops and sharp curves, designed to carry passengers at high speeds.

entity50.name: car
entity50.description: The vehicle part of the roller coaster that carries the riders along the track.

entity51.name: first hill
entity51.description: The initial and often tallest incline on a roller coaster, where the ride begins and potential energy is maximized.

entity52.name: potential energy
entity52.description: A form of stored energy that an object possesses due to its position or configuration, in this case, the height of the roller coaster car on the first hill.

entity53.name: mechanical energy
entity53.description: A form of energy that is the sum of kinetic and potential energies in a system.

entity54.name: system
entity54.description: The part of the universe being studied, which can exchange energy with its surroundings but not matter.

entity55.name: potential energy
entity55.description: Energy possessed by an object due to its position or configuration within a field of force.

entity56.name: kinetic energy
entity56.description: The energy that an object possesses due to its motion, which is proportional to the mass and velocity squared of the object.

entity57.name: car
entity57.description: A vehicle used for transportation, in this context specifically a ride car that moves along a track.

entity58.name: track
entity58.description: The path or route on which the car travels during the ride.

entity59.name: Acceleration
entity59.description: A measure of the rate at which an object's velocity changes with time.

entity60.name: Velocity
entity60.description: The speed of an object in a given direction, often used to describe how fast and in what direction an object is moving.

entity61.name: Roller Coasters
entity61.description: A type of amusement ride that consists of a track with steep drops, sharp curves, and often loops, designed to carry passengers at high speeds.

entity63.description: A measure of the rate and direction of motion, expressed as the distance traveled per unit of time in a specific direction.

entity70.name: Roller coasters
entity70.description: A type of amusement ride that features a track with steep drops, sharp curves, and often loops, designed to provide thrill and excitement.

entity71.name: drops
entity71.description: A part of the roller coaster track where the train descends rapidly from a high point, creating a sensation of falling.

entity72.name: loops
entity72.description: A section of the roller coaster track that forms a complete or partial circle, causing riders to experience inverted positions and G-forces.

entity73.name: roller coasters
entity73.description: A type of amusement ride that uses elevated tracks to guide vehicles through various steep drops, sharp turns, and loops.

entity74.name: forces

entity75.name: energy conservation
entity75.description: The principle that energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transformed from one form to another.

entity76.name: acceleration
entity76.description: The rate of change of velocity with respect to time, often described in physics as the second derivative of position with respect to time.

entity77.name: velocity
entity77.description: A measure of the speed and direction of an object's movement, typically expressed as displacement per unit of time.

entity78.description: Structures or vehicles designed for entertainment in amusement parks, often providing thrilling experiences to visitors.

entity79.description: A type of amusement ride that uses elevated tracks and steep drops to create a thrilling experience for riders.
